description: Hepatic steatosis refers to the accumulation of fat in the liver.

attributes.name: Presence
attributes.description: The presence or absence of hepatic steatosis.

attributes.name: Density (noncontrast exam)
attributes.description: The density of hepatic steatosis on a noncontrast exam (in Hounsfield Units).

values.name: Homogeneous
values.description: Hepatic steatosis has a homogeneous pattern.

values.name: Heterogeneous
values.description: Hepatic steatosis has a heterogeneous pattern.

values.name: Patchy
values.description: Hepatic steatosis has a patchy pattern.

values.name: Geographic
values.description: Hepatic steatosis has a geographic pattern.

attributes.name: Falciform ligament
attributes.description: The presence of focal fat infiltration or focal fat sparing in the falciform ligament.

values.name: Focal fat infiltration
values.description: Focal fat infiltration is present in the falciform ligament.

values.name: Focal fat sparing
values.description: Focal fat sparing is present in the falciform ligament.

attributes.name: Hepatomegaly
attributes.description: The presence or absence of hepatomegaly.

attributes.name: Focal Lesions
attributes.description: The presence or absence of focal lesions in the liver.

values.name: Present
values.description: Focal lesions are present in the liver.

values.name: Absent
values.description: Focal lesions are absent in the liver.

attributes.name: Portal Vein Thrombosis
attributes.description: The presence or absence of portal vein thrombosis.

attributes.name: Ascites
attributes.description: The presence or absence of ascites.

attributes.name: Biliary Dilatation
attributes.description: The presence or absence of biliary dilatation.
